title: Wishing Well
description: On “Wishing Well,“ the late rapper Juice WRLD discusses substance abuse and fame, dropping references to his drug of choice,  Percocet . Juice seemingly predicted his own demise on his June 2018  tribute  to  XXXTENTACION  and  Lil Peep , who also died young: On December 8, 2019, Juice WRLD suffered an  accidental overdose at Midway International Airport  in Chicago.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I can't breathe (Chopsquad), I can't breathe, 999
Waiting for the exhale
I toss my pain with my wishes in a wishing well
I can't breathe, I'm waiting for the exhale
Toss my pain with my wishes in a wishing well
Still no luck, but oh, well
I still try even though I know I'm gon' fail
Stress on my shoulders like a anvil
Perky got me itching like a anthill
Drugs killing me softly, Lauryn Hill
Sometimes I don't know how to feel
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Juice refers to having mixed emotions as he enjoys the satisfaction of taking pills yet knowing that the drugs are slowly taking over him and killing him “softly. “Juice has rapped about having two-sided feelings on his drug addiction multiple times, and expanded on how they help him feel more within the chorus of his March 2019 track, “Feeling," where he raps:I got a feelingPercs help me feel it, I feel it, uhProblems, I numb and conceal themKinda like my feelings, but I still feel them

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Ring-ring, phone call from depression
You used my past and my memories as a weapon
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: While experiencing depression, a person’s negative memories can often feel even worse, as they tend to ruminate over and over again over tense times, making the symptoms worsen. In this hypothetical phone call, Juice speaks to his other main struggle, addiction.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: On the other line, I talk to addiction, huh
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: While experiencing depression, a person’s negative memories can often feel even worse, as they tend to ruminate over and over again over tense times, making the symptoms worsen. In this hypothetical phone call, Juice speaks to his other main struggle, addiction.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Speaking of the devil, all the drugs, I miss them
This can't be real, is it fiction?
Somethin' feels broke, need to fix it
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: The drugs have destroyed his life yet he isn’t sure that is the issue because he is addicted.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I cry out for help, do they listen?
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Juice WRLD is often known for crying out through his music about his struggles with drug addiction – the struggle which ultimately took his life. As he often cried out in his music and to his fans, Jarad battled with prescription drug dependency and depression.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I'ma be alone until it's finished
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: In this line, “it’s finished” is regarding the drugs that he consumes, and that the finish will be when the drugs manage to kill him. Earlier in the line, he said “I'ma be alone”.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: This is the part where I tell you I'm fine, but I'm lyin'
I just don't want you to worry
This is the part where I take all my feelings and hide 'em
'Cause I don't want nobody to hurt me
I can't breathe, I'm waiting for the exhale
Toss my pain with my wishes in a wishing well
Still no luck, but oh, well
I still try even though I know I'm gon' fail
It's stress on my shoulders like a anvil
Perky got me itching like a anthill
Drugs killing me softly, Lauryn Hill
Sometimes I don't know how to feel

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Let's be for real
If it wasn't for the pills, I wouldn't be here
But if I keep taking these pills, I won't be here, yeah
I just told y'all my secret, yeah
It's tearing me to pieces
I really think I need them
I stopped taking the drugs and now the drugs take me
This is the part where I tell you I'm fine, but I'm lyin'
I just don't want you to worry
This is the part where I take all my feelings and hide 'em
'Cause I don't want nobody to hurt me
